info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.graph.l3l4
info.description: l3l4 graph APIs are used to get data for a tenant.

post.description: Request to get l3l4 Application traffic data.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace

x-example: "value"
This request is supported only in system namespace.

l3l4ByApplicationRequest.description: Used to display Application (aka protocol) by tenant
l3l4ByApplicationRequest.title: l3l4 Application Request

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "1570197600"`
end_time.title: End time

namespace.description:
This request is supported only in system namespace.

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-3d

Example: ` "1570194000"`
start_time.title: Start time

l3l4ByMitigationRequest.description: Used to display Zone by tenant
l3l4ByMitigationRequest.title: l3l4 Mitigation Request

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "1570197600"`
end_time.title: End time

namespace.description:
This request is supported only in system namespace.

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-3d

Example: ` "1570194000"`
start_time.title: Start time

top_n.description:
TopN define the number of series returned after sort.

 Optional: If not specified all timeseries are returned

Example: ` "3"`
top_n.title: Top N

end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

l3l4ByZoneRequest.title: l3l4 Zone Request

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

Example: ` "1570197600"`
end_time.title: End time

namespace.description:
This request is supported only in system namespace.

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-3d

start_time.title: Start time

l3l4EventCountRequest.description: Used to display Event counts for a network
l3l4EventCountRequest.title: l3l4 EventsCount Request

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "2021-11-11T06:58:11"`
end_time.title: End time

namespace.description:
This request is supported only in system namespace.

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

network_id.description:
The network id we want the data for. If empty or * is provided then all networks data is returned.

Example: ` "3c33d46b-8f19-420c-9202-038c5833ac55"`
network_id.title: NetworkId

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-1y

Example: ` "2021-11-11T06:58:11"`
start_time.title: Start time

step.description:
step is the resolution width, which determines the number of the data points
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

 Optional: If not specified, then the step will be evaluated to 1d

Example: ` "1d"`
step.title: Step

events.description: List of timelines with event count metrics. Currently two metrics are considered - bounded events and ongoing events.
events.title: Events count

l3l4L3L4GraphValue.description:
Each metric value consists of a timestamp and a value.
Timestamp in the Metric Value is based on the start_time, end_time and step in the request.
Valid values for timestamp are t1=start_time, t2=t1+step, t3=t2+step, ... tn=tn-1+step, where tn <= end_time.
Response may not contain values for all timestamps between start_time and end_time.
l3l4L3L4GraphValue.title: L3L4GraphValue

l3l4MitigationSeriesSort.description:
Used to define the sort of the metrics before returning the top

Unknown or undefined type
Sort by maxfor the timerange.
Sort by average bytes for the timerange.
Sort by pct95 bytes for the timerange.
l3l4MitigationSeriesSort.title: Mitigation Series Sort

l3l4RoutedTraffic.description:
Used to define the routed traffic (Pre or Post scrub)

Unknown or undefined routed traffic (use default)
PreScrub traffic
PostScrub traffic (default)
l3l4RoutedTraffic.title: Routed traffic

l3l4TopTalkersRequest.description: Used to display Top Talkers for a network
l3l4TopTalkersRequest.title: l3l4 TopTalkers Request

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "1570197600"`
end_time.title: End time

namespace.description:
This request is supported only in system namespace.

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-3d

Example: ` "1570194000"`
start_time.title: Start time

l3l4TrafficType.description:
Used to define the type the results should be in.

Unknown or undefined type.
External traffic.
Internal traffic.
l3l4TrafficType.title: Traffic type

l3l4TrafficUnit.description:
Used to define the unit the results should be in.

Unknown or undefined unit.
Bits per second traffic unit.
Packets per second traffic unit.
l3l4TrafficUnit.title: Traffic unit
